key_points: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle reportedly secured a four-book deal with Penguin Random House.
A source claims one of Harry's books is planned following the death of Queen Elizabeth II.
Contrary to reports, a spokesperson for Harry and Meghan stated only one memoir by Harry is planned for late 2022.
It's deemed 'appalling' by sources to link any book release to the Queen's death.
Meghan Markle is set to write a wellness book as part of the deal.
The subjects of the other two books in the deal remain undisclosed.
Harry reportedly led the negotiations from California with a 'take it or leave it' attitude.
Harry allegedly demanded $25 million during negotiations, surprising the publishing team.
The deal, especially Harry's memoir, caused an uproar at Buckingham Palace but is said to represent Harry's 'truth'.
Meghan Markle's children's book, 'The Bench,' became a New York Times Bestseller.
